Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Couldn't connect to logcat, GetProcessId returned: 0 when deploying to Oreo Oneplus Device " (#1677) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. New Project, clean & rebuild, debug on phone, debug again
2. 
3. 

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

No need, create a fresh solution and deploy twice to a OnePlus physical device.

### Expected Behavior
App to open every time it's deployed

### Actual Behavior
Xamarin happens. 

It deploys first time fine and the second time it opens on the device with a white screen and the the app crashes, in VS  the following is displayed in VS t in the Output window

Android application is debugging.
Couldn't connect to logcat, GetProcessId returned: 0

This issuse was reported by Simba Mupfunya [Here](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=60236#c82) and Acknowledged by dean.ellis [Here](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=60236#c91) on  2018-03-21 , and then nothing for over a month, I guess he thought it pixies would just fix it or something .

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CS0433 The type ValueTask<TResult> exists in both System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions and mscorlib in Xamarin.Android 8.3" (#1676) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build it

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

**Repro project**: [https://github.com/yinyue200/taskextest](https://github.com/yinyue200/taskextest)

### Expected Behavior

Build success

### Actual Behavior

The type ValueTask<TResult> exists in both "System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions, Version=4.1.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=cc7b13ffcd2ddd51" and "mscorlib, Version=2.0.5.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=7cec85d7bea7798e"

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[monodroid] Add libjava-interop sources to host runtime sources" (#1675) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "Compiler crashes when building an Android Project (OSX)" (#1674) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Either compile the project using Visual Studio for Mac, or `msbuild` on Terminal. 

Android build tools tried: `27.0.3` and `26.0.3`.
Mono Frameworks tried: `4.8.0` and `4.8.1`. (Mono 4 is required to run legacy libraries).

### Expected Behavior

Compile and generate `.apk` file.

### Actual Behavior

On Visual Studio for Mac, an alert with "Fatal error" message appears, then it closes automatically (without clicking on OK button of the alert window).

On Terminal the following message appears (full output attached):

```
Stacktrace:

  at <unknown> <0xffffffff>
  at Xamarin.Tools.Zip.Native.zip_open (string,Xamarin.Tools.Zip.OpenFlags,Xamarin.Tools.Zip.ErrorCode&) [0x00000] in <0733d002219547e7af60b6fb41716161>:0
  at Xamarin.Tools.Zip.ZipArchive.Open (string,Xamarin.Tools.Zip.OpenFlags) [0x00009] in <0733d002219547e7af60b6fb41716161>:0
  at Xamarin.Tools.Zip.ZipArchive.Open (string,System.IO.FileMode,string,bool,Xamarin.Tools.Zip.IPlatformOptions) [0x0005a] in <0733d002219547e7af60b6fb41716161>:0
  at Xamarin.Android.Tools.Files.ReadZipFile (string,bool) [0x00000] in <fdfe8f54615a4e2ab24c72dc90da5c64>:0
  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.MonoAndroidHelper.IsValidZip (string) [0x00000] in <fdfe8f54615a4e2ab24c72dc90da5c64>:0
  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.GetAdditionalResourcesFromAssemblies.MakeSureLibraryIsInPlace (string,string,string,string,string) [0x00142] in <fdfe8f54615a4e2ab24c72dc90da5c64>:0
  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.GetAdditionalResourcesFromAssemblies.AddAttributeValue (System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<string>,Mono.Cecil.CustomAttribute,string,string,bool,string) [0x002c6] in <fdfe8f54615a4e2ab24c72dc90da5c64>:0
  at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.GetAdditionalResourcesFromAssemblies/<>c__DisplayClass37_0.<DoExecute>b__1 () [0x001a2] in <fdfe8f54615a4e2ab24c72dc90da5c64>:0
  at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.InnerInvoke () [0x00012] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Execute () [0x00016] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ExecutionContextCallback (object) [0x00007] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal (System.Threading.ExecutionContext,System.Threading.ContextCallback,object,bool) [0x0008d] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run (System.Threading.ExecutionContext,System.Threading.ContextCallback,object,bool) [0x00000] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ExecuteWithThreadLocal (System.Threading.Tasks.Task&) [0x0005f] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.ExecuteEntry (bool) [0x0006f] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.Tasks.Task.System.Threading.IThreadPoolWorkItem.ExecuteWorkItem () [0x00000] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading.ThreadPoolWorkQueue.Dispatch () [0x00096] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at System.Threading._ThreadPoolWaitCallback.PerformWaitCallback () [0x00000] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0
  at (wrapper runtime-invoke) <Module>.runtime_invoke_bool (object,intptr,intptr,intptr) [0x0001e] in <f712f98eb8e445c8918edaf595bbe465>:0

(native stacktrace)

=================================================================
Got a SIGSEGV while executing native code. This usually indicates
a fatal error in the mono runtime or one of the native libraries 
used by your application.
=================================================================
```

### Version Information

=== Visual Studio Community 2017 for Mac ===

Version 7.5 (build 1254)
Installation UUID: 8fbd2e42-6a70-4878-b267-e7b22af25c7f
Runtime:
	Mono 5.10.1.47 (2017-12/8eb8f7d5e74) (64-bit)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Severity Code Description Project File Line Suppression State Error errors (CssLint) Unexpected token '^' at line 1, col 2." (#2695) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: i am having this error in my Xamarin forms CSS

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Provide FlexLayout support for aligning with auto margins" (#2694) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

"auto" doesn't appear to be a valid margin value when using FlexLayout.  It is allowed in CSS and is very useful for aligning elements, see [Aligning with auto margins](https://www.w3.org/TR/css-flexbox-1/#auto-margins).

### Steps to Reproduce
Add the following style:
   ` margin-left: auto;`

### Basic Information

   ` <PackageReference Include="Xamarin.Forms" Version="3.0.0.446417" />`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Crash when setting RenderingApi on SCNRenderingOptions" (#4087) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The key for `RenderingApi` seems to be incorrect on iOS 11.3 and using it results in an ArgumentNull exception.

### Steps to Reproduce

```
new SCNView (UIScreen.MainScreen.Bounds, new SCNRenderingOptions {
            RenderingApi = SCNRenderingApi.Metal,
        })
```

1. Run that code on iOS 11.3
2. Note the crash

### Expected Behavior

SCNView is created with Meta.

### Actual Behavior

Crash

```
System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: key
  at Foundation.DictionaryContainer.NullCheckAndRemoveKey (Foundation.NSString key, System.Boolean removeEntry) [0x0001e] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/11.10.1.174/src/Xamarin.iOS/Foundation/DictionaryContainer.cs:330 
  at Foundation.DictionaryContainer.SetNumberValue (Foundation.NSString key, System.Nullable`1[T] value) [0x00000] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/11.10.1.174/src/Xamarin.iOS/Foundation/DictionaryContainer.cs:390

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin.iOS Binding for native SDK gets "ObjCRuntime\Trampolines.g.cs" class file broken" (#4086) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
I implemented a Xamarin.iOS binding library using Sharpie for a mobile SDK native available for iOS only.

I ran over most of the documentation about Sharpie but I'm facing this issue when building the project:

* After creating the binding and use it for a Xamarin.Forms (iOS only) it It gets a compiling issue for a generated class file. 
* I'm able to fix it manually by changing the misinterpreted type to a "var" and that's it.
* Unfortunately, my CI pipeline can't do that so it gets broken builds too.

Output file in VS for Mac
../[ProjectName.iOS]/obj/Debug/ios/ObjCRuntime/Trampolines.g.cs

![Trampolines.cs](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZd9BKJWsAEsoDW.jpg)
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamarin binding project
2. Bring a .framework file
3. Use Sharpie for creating the Binding
4. Reference your new binding as part of a Xamarin iOS project (aka Xamarin.Forms flavored project)
5. Clean All and build the project

### Expected Behavior
Building the Xamarin Binding shouldn't bring up compiling issues on internal/generated tooling classes

### Actual Behavior
Local development build broken, CI/CD pipeline got broken too

### Environment
VS For Mac

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[msbuild] Adds minimum support for XM binding projects from VS" (#4080) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Minimum support means:
- Letting users open XM binding projects
- Building XM binding projects offline (not connected to the Mac)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Create simulators if they don't already exist." (#4085) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Create any needed simulators, instead of relying on them already existing (or
someone manually creating them).

A nice side effect is that it will become possible to delete all simulators on
a bot (to reclaim space), and they'll be re-created when needed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Don't make a potentially blocking call to enumerate device candidates in VerifyRun." (#4084) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Enumerating device candidates can block (if the devices haven't been populated
yet), so make the whole thing async-based instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Wait for a build to finish even if it has started." (#4083) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Because build tasks might be shared between tests, and if another test already
started a build, this test must still wait until the build finishes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Don't load simulators multiple times at the same time." (#4082) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Closed issue "Metal Shaders hard coded to osx-metal1.0 can't use 1.2 or 2.0" (#4019) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Here we hard code 1.0: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/blob/master/msbuild/Xamarin.MacDev.Tasks.Core/Tasks/MetalTaskBase.cs#L80

This likely needs to be more flexible.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Make sure to cancel the test listener both for device and simulator builds." (#4081) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
This will make xharness not listen for tests to connect forever, decrease the
number of threads needed, and as well not print loads of aborted messages when
xharness exits:

    SimpleTcpListener: an exception occurred in processing thread: System.Threading.ThreadAbortException: Thread was being aborted.
      at xharness.SimpleTcpListener.Start () [0x0009d] in /Users/XamarinQA/vsts/_work/1/s/tests/xharness/SimpleTcpListener.cs:44
      at xharness.SimpleListener.<StartAsync>b__41_0 () [0x00002] in /Users/XamarinQA/vsts/_work/1/s/tests/xharness/SimpleListener.cs:93

Events.RelatedBody: Add the compression framework, this is a C API.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xcode 9.3 integration - Could not insert new outlet connection" (#4078) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: There are multiple people using Xcode 9.3 with Xamarin.Mac who are unable to add outlets to the Xcode project when editing a storyboard. It appears inconsistent, as it failed for me yesterday but works today? I am not certain that this is a XM bug, but opened this for tracking. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open storyboard 2. In Xcode add control and attempt to create outlet 3. ?? ### Expected Behavior Xcode to allow outline ### Actual Behavior ### Environment https://gist.github.com/chamons/c414e2a969a123db4ed3de3930b99a8d
